snippet: Few questions in Indian politics have generated as much raw emotion, pro and con, as the proposed creation of Telangana State. The vote set off celebrations and protests.
abstract: Bill on proposed creation of Telangana, 29th state in India, finally reaches lower house of Parliament and is passed unanimously, after more than 40 years of dispute; vote sets off delirious celebrations and protests; if bill is passed by the upper house, Hyderabad will remain the capital of both Andhra Pradesh, state which would be divided to create Telangana, and new state for 10 years.

byline.contributor: Vivekananda Nemana and Sriram Karri contributed reporting from Hyderabad, India, and Hari Kumar from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Few questions in Indian politics have generated as much raw emotion, pro and con, as the proposed creation of Telangana State. The vote set off celebrations and protests.

headline.main: Lower House in India Passes Bill to Create a 29th State
headline.print_headline: Lower House in India Passes Bill to Create a 29th State
